meanings.definition: A quantity of liquid, especially when drunk in a single draft.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, he drank two waughts of water to quench his thirst.
meanings.sent2: The bartender poured three waughts of beer for the thirsty customers.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to have magical powers, claiming she could turn waughts of juice into potions.
meanings.sent4: The lake shimmered under the moonlight, reflecting the stars like waughts of liquid silver.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully measured out waughts of broth to create the perfect soup.

meanings.definition: To drink something in a single draft.
meanings.sent1: She waughts her morning coffee quickly before heading to work.
meanings.sent2: The athletes waughted their energy drinks before the race.
meanings.sent3: The cat waughts its milk noisily, making a mess on the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: The river waughts down the mountainside, carving a path through the rocks.
meanings.sent5: He waughts the potion in one gulp, hoping for a magical effect.
